qas.question: What type of description did the term "Gothic architecture" originate as?
Who used the term "barbarous German style" to portray what is known today as the Gothic style?
Who does Vasari believe destroyed ancient buildings after they conquered Rome?
How long had Italy undergone building in a Classical architecture style at the time of Vasari?
In what period was the Classical architecture vocabulary revived?
What type of description did the term "Gothic architecture" dismiss?
Who used the term "barbarous German style" to portray what is known today as the Modern style?
Who does Vasari believe destroyed new buildings after they fell to Rome?
How long had Italy stopped building in a Classical architecture style at the time of Vasari?
What period was the Classical architecture vocabulary forgotten?

context: The term "Gothic architecture" originated as <a0_0><b5_0>a pejorative description<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0><b6_0>Giorgio Vasari<b6_0/><a1_0/> used the term "barbarous German style" in his Lives of the Artists to describe what is now considered the Gothic style, and in the introduction to the Lives he attributes various architectural features to <a2_0><b7_0>"the Goths"<b7_0/><a2_0/> whom he holds responsible for destroying the ancient buildings after they conquered Rome, and erecting new ones in this style. At the time in which Vasari was writing, Italy had experienced <a3_0><b8_0>a century<b8_0/><a3_0/> of building in the Classical architectural vocabulary revived in <a4_0><b9_0>the Renaissance<b9_0/><a4_0/> and seen as evidence of a new Golden Age of learning and refinement.
